ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to edit my writing, copy the style of other writers, hone in on details, evaluate other people's work, and how to fully develop a character.

Other than the course material, I have gained a deeper insight about the way I ultimately learn and study best. I found out what worked and what did not work when trying to review and learn new material. Especially since this was such a fast paced tempo class.
I became much more confident in my ability to write creatively in the mediums of short stories, poetry, and drama.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strengths of this class were that there were workshops and discussions. I liked bouncing my ideas off the ideas of the other students and learning from their writing, and trying to apply that to my own writing. I feel like some of the assignments could've been a little more specific, but overall I really enjoyed this course,
The strength of the course is the professor. The way the professor conducted the course was great.
This course benefitted tremendously from Prof. Spargo's hands-on feedback and in-class discussions and workshopping.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to someone who loves writing and isn't afraid of editing. I think the feedback given was really good and I think any writer could benefit from taking this class. There was a lot of work to be completed, but I think it was worth it.
Yes, if they want to (re)activate the creative writing part of their mind!

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.

extras.title: ENGL S123 01 - Intro to Creative Writing
